dct_title_s: [Series of maps from Manual of biblical geography]
dct_alternative_sm: Manual of biblical geography a text-book on Bible history : especially prepared for the use of students and teachers of the Bible, and for Sunday school instruction : containing maps, plans, review charts, colored diagrams, and illustrated with accurate views of the principal cities and localities known to Bible history
dct_description_sm: Rand, McNally & co., engr's. ; [by J.L. Hurlbut].
Relief shown by hachures and pictorially.
Coordinates approximate and based on Greenwich meridian.
Bar scales on maps given in "Statute miles", "Feet", "Miles", "Stadia", "English feet", and "English miles".
Includes 2 illustrations: Moabite stone -- Black obelisk.

Includes 3 charts: Comparative age of the patriarchs before and after the deluge -- Comparative area of Palestine at different periods -- Comparative areas of the great empires-Assyrian, Babylonian, Persian.
Shows topography, drainage, boundaries, travel routes, places of historical interest.
Includes 2 indexes: [Sites of historical interest] -- References, Christian quarter.
Descriptive text: The Old Testament world.

Inset maps: Map [12]: Palestine before the conquest. Map [14]: Vicinity of Mount Sinai. Map [17]: Beth-horon and vicinity. Map [20]: The plain of Esdraelon. Map [21]: Saul's last battle. Map [52]: Philip's journey -- Peter's journey. Map [65]: Maltese Islands.

dct_rightsHolder_sm: Images from the Leonard and Juliet Rothman Holy Lands Map Collection courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu
